name: Quick and Easy Pancit
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'dried rice noodles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, finely diced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'diced cooked chicken breast meat'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small head', 'name': 'cabbage, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'carrot, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lemons - cut into wedges, for garnish'}

name: Authentic Filipino Pancit
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'boneless chicken thighs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'dried rice noodles'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy-based liquid seasoning (such as Maggi®), or to taste'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'large head', 'name': 'cabbage, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'carrots, julienned'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic salt'}
steps: Bring a pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add chicken thighs and boil until no longer pink in the centers and juices run clear, about 30 minutes. Strain broth into a bowl to reserve. Shred chicken thighs using 2 forks.. Place noodles in a large bowl and pour in hot chicken broth, adding hot water to cover if needed. Set aside until noodles are softened, 5 to 7 minutes. Blanch noodles with cold water and drain well. Place into a bowl and add soy seasoning, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and sesame oil. Mix well and set aside.. Heat remaining olive oil in a skillet or large wok over medium-high heat. Saute garlic in the hot oil until it begins to brown, about 1 minute. Add onion and cook for 2 minutes. Add chicken, cabbage, and carrots. Stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes; season with garlic salt. Mix chicken mixture with noodles, add soy seasoning to taste, and serve.

name: Grandma Nena's Lumpia and Pancit
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'boneless, skinless chicken breast halves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'boneless pork sirloin, cut into 1/2 inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'head', 'name': 'cabbage, shredded'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'carrots, diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pinches', 'name': 'monosodium glutamate (MSG) (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': '', 'name': 'spring roll wrappers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'quart', 'name': 'oil for frying'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'dry pancit (Canton) noodles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'chopped garlic'}
steps: Bring 2 quarts of water of water to a boil in a saucepan. Add chicken, and cook for 10 to 15 minutes, or until done. Reserve chicken stock, and allow chicken to cool. Cut chicken into small cubes.. In a large skillet or wok, saute pork until evenly brown. Stir in chicken, cabbage, and carrots. Cook over medium heat until cabbage is tender. Remove from heat, and allow to cool slightly while you separate the wrappers.. In small bowl, combine enough flour and water to make a paste about the consistency of glue. Spoon meat mixture into a thin line on each wrapper, and roll up, using a dab of the flour paste to seal the edge. Keep each lumpia thin; if you over fill them, the wrapper will tear. Save about 1/2 to 1/4 of the filling in the pot for the pancit.. Heat large skillet with 1/2 to 1 inch of oil. Fry the lumpia one side at a time, until a nice golden brown. Drain, standing each piece upright, in a pot or bowl lined with paper towel.. Return the remainder of the filling to the stove, and gently mix in the pancit noodles. Gradually add the chicken stock, and cook until noodles are tender.. For the sauce: With a mortar and pestle or back of a spoon, crush the garlic, then mix into the vinegar. Serve in small bowls with spoons. The sauce can be used as a dip, or to spoon into the lumpia.

name: Filipino Spaghetti
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'spaghetti'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'head', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground pork'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(26.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'spaghetti sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14 ounce) jar', 'name': 'banana ketchup'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'hot dogs, sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese'}
steps: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Once the water is boiling, stir in the spaghetti, and return to a boil. Cook the pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the pasta has cooked through, but is still firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Drain well in a colander set in the sink.. Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in the garlic and onion; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in the beef and pork; season with salt and pepper. Cook and stir until the meat has browned. Pour in the spaghetti sauce, banana ketchup, sugar, and water. Simmer until the sauce has thickened, about 15 minutes. Stir in hot dog slices and continue to cook until hot dogs are heated through. Serve over spaghetti with Cheddar cheese sprinkled on top.

name: Filipino Pancit Bihon with Canton
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'pancit bihon (rice noodles)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped cooked chicken'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh shrimp, peeled and deveined'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small head', 'name': 'cabbage, shredded'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'celery, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'carrot, peeled and cut into matchsticks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'pancit canton (yellow Chinese noodles)'}
steps: Soak bihon in a bowl of warm water until soft, about 5 minutes. Drain.. Heat oil in a large wok over medium-high heat. Saute onion and garlic until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add chicken, salt, and pepper. Cook and stir until flavors combine, about 3 minutes. Add shrimp; cook until they start to turn color, about 1 minute. Add soy sauce; toss in cabbage, celery, and carrot. Cook until well combined, about 2 minutes. Add 2 cups water; bring to a boil. Cook until vegetables begin to soften, about 2 minutes.. Transfer chicken, shrimp, and vegetables to a bowl, leaving the liquid behind in the wok. Add bihon and canton noodles to the liquid. Mix well and cover. Let sit until tender, about 5 minutes. Return 1/2 the chicken-vegetable mixture to the wok; mix with the noodles. Pour soup into bowls; garnish with the remaining chicken-vegetable mixture.

name: Pork and Shrimp Pancit
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6.75 ounce) package', 'name': 'rice noodles'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cooked small shrimp, diced'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped cooked pork'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground ginger'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'shredded bok choy'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'oyster sauce'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'crushed red pepper flakes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onion, minced'}
steps: Soak rice noodles in warm water in a bowl for 20 minutes; drain.. Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a wok or large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté noodles for 1 minute; transfer to a serving dish, and keep warm. Add remaining 2 tablespoons oil to wok; sauté shrimp, pork, onion, garlic, and ginger for 1 minute.. Stir in bok choy, chicken broth, and oyster sauce; season with pepper flakes. Cover; cook until bok choy is wilted, about 1 minute. Serve over noodles; garnish with green onion.

name: Pancit Sotanghon
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10.5 ounce) package', 'name': 'mung bean vermicelli'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried wood ear mushrooms (tenga ng daga)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'achiote powder'}, {'quantity': '1 ¾', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped cooked chicken'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cube', 'name': 'chicken bouillon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'shredded cabbage'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small head', 'name': 'bok choy, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'carrot, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'chili powder (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'hard-boiled eggs, sliced'}
steps: Soak vermicelli in a bowl of hot water, 2 to 3 minutes. Drain. Cut noodles to desired length; set aside. Soak mushrooms in a second bowl of water; set aside to soften.. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook and stir garlic in hot oil until browned, about 2 minutes. Remove garlic to a bowl and set aside for garnish. Add onion and achiote powder to the saucepan and sauté until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add chicken, soy sauce, and fish sauce. Stir in bouillon until dissolved. Pour in 1 cup water and bring to a boil.. Drain softened mushrooms and cut into 1-inch pieces.. Toss cabbage, bok choy, and carrot into boiling water mixture. Add vermicelli, mushrooms, black pepper, and chili powder. Cook, mixing well, until pancit is slightly dried, about 5 minutes. Transfer pancit to a platter. Garnish with egg slices and browned garlic.

name: Pancit Molo (Filipino Wonton Soup)
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'ground pork'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'sliced water chestnuts, drained'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'name': 'wonton wrappers, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cooked chicken breast, shredded'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'quarts', 'name': 'chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small head', 'name': 'bok choy, cut into bite-sized pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, chopped'}
steps: Mix pork, shrimp, water chestnuts, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl. Reserve 1/3 of the filling mixture for soup. Wrap about 1 tablespoon of remaining filling in a wonton wrapper. Repeat until all filling is used up.. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic; sauté until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in chicken and reserved filling. Mix well. Add chicken broth; season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Drop filled wontons into soup one by one. Boil until wontons float to the top, 3 to 5 minutes. Add bok choy; boil until tender, about 2 minutes more. Garnish with green onions.

name: Pancit
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'thin rice noodles'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'skinless, boneless chicken legs, cut into bite-sized pieces'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'pork tenderloin, cut into bite-sized pieces'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'ground black pepper, to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'medium head', 'name': 'cabbage, shredded'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'carrots, shredded'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'shrimp, peeled and deveined'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'green onions, chopped into 1-inch pieces'}
steps: Place rice noodles in a large bowl and cover with warm water. Set aside until noodles are softened; cut into 4-inch lengths. Drain and set aside.. Brown chicken and pork in a skillet over medium heat until no pink shows; season with soy sauce and black pepper. Remove from skillet and set aside. Sauté cabbage and carrots in same skillet until tender. Stir in noodles, shrimp, and green onions; cook for 4 to 5 minutes. Stir in chicken and pork; cook 5 minutes more.
